content: sunshine on my feet knitting and needle crafts bring joy at any time but even more so when we are facing difficult or uncertain times the colour and design of these socks is so cheery and bright they truly are like sunshine for your feet these socks are knit in dk sock and are a quick and fun knit the pattern is easy to memorize and will be sure to put a smile on the face of whoever you knit them for size approx foot circumference adult medium yarn medium a handmade journey dk in golden amber 8½ inches or 22 cm 100% super wash merino needles 250 yd 115 g 3 25 mm or us 3 double pointed needles notions set of 5 tapestry needle stitch markers optional or your preferred needles for knitting in the round or on gauge 2 circular needles 22 stitches = approx 10 cm unblocked ___________________________________________________________________________ note for a tighter fabric and snugger fitting sock you can knit these socks on us 2 5 3 mm needles the pattern is written to be knit with dpns but can be adapted for knitting in the round or with 2 circular needles magic loop if that s your preferred method ready to cast on here we go cast on 48 stitches using the long tail cast on method distribute evenly on 4 needles you should have 12 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches cuff k2 p2 for 10 rounds sunshine pattern for the leg using the written instructions below works rounds 1 through 12 one time this will give you a leg length of approx 2 5 inches 6 25 cm tip you can knit more or fewer repeats of the pattern depending on how long you want your sock to be but be sure to end after round 4 8 or 12 written instructions for sunshine pattern round 1-4 *p2 k4* repeat to end of round round 5-8 *k2 p2 k2* repeat to end of round round 9-12 *k4 p2* repeat to end of round 2 © the kitchen sink shop heel flap set up knit across the n1 and n2 in the sunshine pattern will be round 1 these will be the front of the sock or instep and these stitches will not be worked again until after the heel flap and heel turn are finished heel flap for the heel flap and heel turn you will only be working with the 24 stitches that are now on n3 and n4 in row 1 you will be working all stitches from both n3 and n4 onto n3 therefore combining those 24 stitches onto one needle for the heel flap and heel turn n1 and n2 are now the front instep of the sock and n3 will hold the 24 stitches from n3 and n4 row 1 rs *s1 knit wise k1* to end row 2 ws turn work around so now the purl
